page.title: 13HAWARDEN AIRPORT
page.content:
of 45%. This was said to be about the break-even figure. During June 1979 Air Anglia bought out Air Wales and the service was suspended pending a re-evaluation. The last trip was made from Hawarden to Cardiff on 25th June 1979 by Navajo G-BAVM, on lease from Air Commuter whilst the usual G-BWAL was on maintenance.
British Aerospace Aircraft Group Civil Division Chester. 12th June '85 Class 3B Dear Hilary and Elizabeth, Thank you very much for your letter, and I hope I can answer your questions. As a point of interest, although this is an airfield it is also primarily a factory, and so we obviously don't
